<JD_START>
Job Title: Sr. Visual Designer, Shopbop Visual Design

Location: Madison, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations

Description:
Description

Shopbop is seeking a talented, customer-focused Senior Production Designer our web retail design team at our headquarters in Madison, WI. This position is an amazing opportunity to work for a rapidly-growing and innovative online fashion company.

The Senior Production Designer will report to the Head of Visual Design to oversee the build and production of daily web content and projects related to the shopbop.com website including but not limited to the homepage, landing pages, promotions, email, and all other content for desktop, mobile and app formats. This is a role where accuracy and attention to detail is valued and expected. This position requires strong organizational skills, web expertise, intrinsic design ability, typographic skills, and acute attention to detail. The ability to manage multiple projects and communicate with key stakeholders is essential. The Senior Production Designer will be responsible for owning and innovating new process and protocols to invent and simplify workflows.

Key job responsibilities

 Hands-on production of sophisticated multi-page web experiences Extensive web publishing, including the creation of web graphics and video Manage multiple projects, communicating with Visual Designers and other teams to ensure timely delivery of all graphic assets Responsible for cross-functional distribution and in some cases, publishing of those assets Proofing and reviewing experiences prior to launch and ensuring the highest quality is delivered Responsible for working with cross-functional partners to develop and own, document and implement new process and protocols for ease of workflow Responsible for liaison with cross-functional partners Responsible for overseeing and managing junior production freelance designers Work independently and effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment Meticulous with all production and design details Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills Excellent skills in Adobe Photoshop Knowledge of new and existing project management workflow tools Knowledge of Mobile Device CSS Styling Experience with web content management application(s)

About The Team

Shopbop is the global online retail destination for style inspiration and discovery, offering customers all over the world a comprehensive, hand-picked selection of ready-to-wear apparel and accessories from over 1,000 established and emerging designers. Shopbop debuts new arrivals, compelling editorial content and styling guidance daily. Shopbop provides world-class customer service, fast, free global shipping worldwide and free returns in the U.S. and Canada.

Shopbop is at the intersection of ecommerce, fashion and technology. We promote a collaborative culture, as our teams cooperate across departments within Shopbop and Amazon to continually innovate in an effort to better serve our global customer. You’ll work with big thinkers on projects that leave a mark on our organization, as well as on the broader technology, retail and fashion teams. Shopbop is at the cutting edge of e-commerce, and we are driven to be the daily destination inspiring fashion worldwide, merging a comprehensive brand list and strong editorial perspective with an easy-to-shop, sure-to-delight user experience.

Acquired in 2006, BOP LLC is a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., the world’s largest online retailer. Offering an enhanced customer experience, Shopbop is a globally recognized and trusted fashion retailer that sells only quality, authentic contemporary and designer merchandise.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Madison, WI, USA

Basic Qualifications

 3+ years of design experience Have an available online portfolio Experience working with agile development teams (agile/scrum/kanban) Experience in Adobe Creative Suit applications, with high proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, and Acrobat using macOS

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience with e-commerce, search, social, and other major application types and their UX patterns Experience creating services and applications with multiple user touch points on different platforms and devices

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


Company - Bop LLC

Job ID: A2618578

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
